overview_of_class: Prohealth Proseminar I will meet during the first fall quarter of the students' pre-health program to prepare students to succeed in the professional health careers program. This proseminar series will be completed by PROHLTH 396-B: Prohealth Proseminar II in the students' final spring quarter. This non-credit course covers topics including adjusting to life as a science student, academic resources, extracurricular resources, and preparing for the professional/medical school application process. There is no tuition charged for this course.
name: Professional Health Careers Proseminar I
title: SCS PRO_HLTH 396-A-60 Professional Health Careers Proseminar I

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Prohealth Proseminar I will meet during the first fall quarter of the students' pre-health program to prepare students to succeed in the professional health careers program. This proseminar series will be completed by PROHLTH 396-B: Prohealth Proseminar II in the students' final spring quarter. This non-credit course covers topics including adjusting to life as a science student, academic resources, extracurricular resources, and preparing for the professional/medical school application process. There is no tuition charged for this course.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: This course is by permission only and available only to students in the professional health careers certificate program. Please email kate-schultz@northwestern.edu for a permission number.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
By the end of Proseminar I, students will be able to:
1. Apply strategies to effectively prioritize and manage their time
2. Identify academic and professional success resources including academic and career advising, faculty, tutoring, and web resources
3. Identify appropriate campus and off-campus resources and opportunities to build their clinical resumes
4. Develop skills to build positive relationships with peers, faculty, and the community
5. Create a personalized MCAT preparation and medical school application timeline

subject: PRO_HLTH
